If video poker is your game of choice, we offer all the popular variations, including 33 multi-game machines at the exciting Sunburst Lounge, an elevated bar located at the center of the circular casino. 
Virtual table games is a great way to enjoy games such as blackjack and roulette in the form of a slot machine.  Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs offers virtual blackjack in denominations starting at $5 and games for both smoking and non-smoking guests. 
The new casino offers high ceilings and a state-of-the-art air handling system.  Seventy-five percent of the casino floor offers non-smoking slots while twenty-five percent offers a wide variety of options for guests who do smoke.  
 Coinless ticket in-ticket out technology is offered on all games.
The smartest tip for all slot players is to sign up for a Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs' Player's Club card and use it every time they play our action-packed slot machines.  New Players card members receive ten dollars in Free Slot Play for a limited time.

CRUISE GIVEAWAY RULES & REGULATIONS
The Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs Earn A Cruise Giveaway
promotional period begins on January 1, 2009 at 6am and ends on February 28, 2009 at midnight.
Player’s Club Card holders who earn 200 points during the
promotional period with their Players card successfully inserted in a slot machine will be eligible for a 5-7 day cruise with Norwegian Cruise Line.

The establishment of any and all arrangements for the cruise is between the winner and Norewegian Cruise Line.
Cruise winners are responsible for select fees associated with the cruise.
Employees of Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs and its affiliates are not eligible to participate in the promotion.
Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs reserves the right to cancel
or change this promotion at any time.
By participating in this promotion, you authorize Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs to use your name and/or likeness, photographic or otherwise, for such publicity purposes as deemed appropriate.
A valid government-issued photo identification is required
to claim any prize.
All applicable Federal and State taxes and/or miscellaneous cruise fees associated with the prize are the responsibility of the winner.
The cruise is non-transferable.

It also makes them unrivaled in gaming services and amenities. They’ve also brought in a variety of dining options that people in this area are craving.  Whether it’s fine dining at Ruth’s Chris Steak House or Rustic Kitchen Bistro and Bar, casual dining at Timbers Buffet, or a delicious quick meal at the Sky Court Food Court, there’s something to satisfy every appetite.  Shopping here is a whole new experience.  Finely crafted jewelry, the latest fashions and accessories and a logo shop are just a few of the shopping opportunities available.  And they put the ‘life’ in nightlife with the fabulous Sunburst Bar in the heart of the action, and eclectic entertainment and high kickin’ fun at Breakers Bar.  There’s so much to do and see here that you really do need to experience it for yourself.  And while it may be impossible to do all in one day, it’s the kind of place you’ll want to go back to time and again.
ABOUT THE AUTHORITY
The Authority is an instrumentality of the Mohegan Tribe of Indians of Connecticut, a federally recognized Indian tribe with an approximately 507-acre reservation situated in southeastern Connecticut, adjacent to Uncasville, Connecticut.

The Authority has been granted the exclusive power to conduct and regulate gaming activities on the existing reservation of the Tribe, including the operation of Mohegan Sun, a gaming and entertainment complex that is situated on a 185-acre site on the Tribe’s reservation. Through its subsidiary, Downs Racing, L.P., the Authority also owns and operates Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs, a gaming and entertainment facility offering slot machines and harness racing in Plains Township, Pennsylvania and several OTW facilities located elsewhere in Pennsylvania.

Pocono Libertarians Background
Every locality has on-going discussions about community and national issues.  They occur in service clubs, community organizations or the media.  More often than not, though, they center on how to use the power of government to improve conditions or to solve problems, with a firm conviction that government can solve all problems and that it can do no harm.
Libertarians take issue with the involuntary means government uses to attain its ends.  Mandates and prohibitions invariably limit the allowable range of experimentation.  Freedom allows spontaneous order, which is seen in systems as diverse as artificial neural networks, agoric computers, biological evolution, ecosystems, and free-market economies.

Our monthly op-ed column entitled, "The Liberty Corner" can be read in the award-winning Community Express newspaper distributed throughout our area.
Our motto is, in the words of the late Nobel laureate Friedrich A. Hayek, " to make the building of a free society once more an intellectual adventure."
Read what Ernie Preate Jr., Former Attorney General of Pennsylvania and other past speakers have said about the Pocono Libertarians!
Don't forget to stop on by to sign and view our guestbook!
Don't forget to visit our Webrings!

Many of the things that the government tries to do from good intentions could be better handled by spontaneous voluntary systems, and often governments attempts to impose solutions to problems do more harm than good.
Investor's Business Daily and the internationally published Financial Times featured stories pointing out the exponential growth of libertarian think-tanks and discussion clubs, like ours, which are once again focusing on the eternal conflict between government and freedom.
Founded in 1991, the Pocono Libertarians is a free monthly discussion forum bringing to Monroe County, Pennsylvania, interesting speakers and thought-provoking topics consistent with the philosophy of individual liberty, personal responsibility, free markets, and choice in all matters. It is the goal of the Pocono Libertarians to inject into the local dialog the premise that freedom does matter.  To that end, we sponsor a free monthly discussion forum usually held at 7pm, the third Thursday of each month.  We are proud of the programs we've hosted in our thirteen year history.

"While golfers love unwrapping a dozen golf balls or this year's hot
new gadget that promises to improve their game, what could be better
than opening a card that promises a season's worth of golf?" asks PMVB
Executive Director Robert Uguccioni. "The Pocono Mountains offer
championship courses that will challenge the best golfer as well as
options that are both economical and kind to the less-skilled player."
The Pocono Mountains: Discover Golf's Great Destination Secret, are
home to hundreds of holes of golf from legendary designers such as A.W.
Tillinghast, Donald Ross and Jack Nicklaus.  With classic designs that
feature tight fairways and small greens, to expansive resort courses
and modern gems, the four-county region has something to satisfy every
taste.
Various stay-and-play packages are available for gifts as well.

These are as varied as the courses themselves, such as an early-spring overnight to enjoy the budding flowers or a ladies day at the course with a trip to the spa after 18 holes of championship golf.
A complete list of Pocono Mountains golf courses and links to individual web sites can be found at www.poconosgolf.com. The venerable destination, with the brand campaign and slogan, "It's Time for the Pocono Mountains," also provides the ideal backdrop for corporate outings and meetings.  If it's an overnight stay, a weekend getaway or an extended vacation, people are increasingly discovering the convenience and proximity of the Pocono Mountains properties and value-laden packages.
  In addition to the many golf options, the mountain destination is blessed with numerous lakes and rivers, miles of marked and unmarked trails for hiking and biking, fine dining, shopping and historical site seeing.  Gaming has come to the Pocono Mountains, as well, with Mount Airy Casino Resort introducing slot machines earlier this fall.

Poconos Camp
Camp
Ramah in the Poconos
Camp
Ramah in the Poconos is located in the scenic mountain region of Wayne
County in Northeastern Pennsylvania.  The natural beauty of the Poconos
provides an ideal setting for a summer camping experience.  The camp
is approximately 3 hours driving time from both New York City and
Philadelphia.
Our modern pool and beautiful
lake provide the perfect setting for Red Cross certification, and
instruction in boating, canoeing, kayaking, sailing and windsurfing.
Sport choices include
basketball, baseball, floor hockey, soccer, volleyball, gymnastics
and tennis.  Special sports programs include inter-camp games, sports
marathon, Ramah Tennis Open and Maccabiah.  Campers are also exposed
to cultural arts through studio arts, photography, woodworking,
radio, dance and drama.  Plays and other camp-wide cultural programs
are performed throughout the summer.
Basic outdoor
living skills are taught in camp through age appropriate experiences
culminating in backpacking and overnight hikes and canoe trips.
Ecology, the Jewish connection to nature, and camping skills
are integrated with group building and personal achievement
challenges.
Camp Ramah
in the Poconos offers a five-day Kesher Program for Jewish
families with deaf or hard of hearing members.

2005 Pocono 500 at Pocono RacewayBy Steve McCormick, About.com
Filed In:History of NASCAR
> Previous Races
Superspeedway that drives like a road course: The most unusual track layout on the NASCAR schedule.  Pocono Raceway has a massive front straight that often sees cars going
four, five and six wide.  Add the high speeds to the challenging turns and you've got a 2.5 mile superspeedway that drives
like a road course.The Track: Pocono Speedway is a 2.5 mile three-cornered speedway.  The triangle-shaped track has three different corner lengths and
bankings making it very difficult to set up a car and to drive well.  Pocono is, in a word, unique.As difficult as it is to
set up and drive Pocono frequently hosts some great racing with races often decided within the last couple of laps.Race Distance: 200 laps = 500 milesThe Big Picture: This is race number 14 of 36.  We are halfway to the cutoff.  It is time to make your move if you want to race
for The Chase.

Welcome to Lake Naomi Club
This is a private, non-profit country club, which in turn is owned by its member/property owners.
Certainly the main attraction is Lake Naomi itself.  It is one of the largest private lakes in the Poconos.
A 100 foot "greenbelt", where many trees may not be removed, protects the lake and guarantees
a pristine, atmosphere...even though the lake is surrounded by hundreds of homes.
The lack of power boats ensures a clean, tranquil setting.

Pocono
PA Green Commuting Resources
In the coming weeks, we hope to fill out this Pocono PA green commuting page to provide you with
valuable green commuting and carpooling information and connections. 
If you are looking for someone to car pool with, please send me an e-mail
and I will post your request on this page.
  The Pocono area has a very limited amount of public transportation, so we
must compensate by carpooling, if we want to save money, fuel, and limit
dumping more carbon monoxide and carbon dioxide into the atmosphere.
For fun, check out this carbon
dioxide calculator to figure out just how much you contribute to
global warming with your car, rail, electricity, heat, air travel, and
kissing.

It also makes them unrivaled in gaming services and amenities. They’ve also brought in a variety of dining options that people in this area are craving.  Whether it’s fine dining at Ruth’s Chris Steak House or Rustic Kitchen Bistro and Bar, casual dining at Timbers Buffet, or a delicious quick meal at the Sky Court Food Court, there’s something to satisfy every appetite.  Shopping here is a whole new experience.  Finely crafted jewelry, the latest fashions and accessories and a logo shop are just a few of the shopping opportunities available.  And they put the ‘life’ in nightlife with the fabulous Sunburst Bar in the heart of the action, and eclectic entertainment and high kickin’ fun at Breakers Bar.  There’s so much to do and see here that you really do need to experience it for yourself.  And while it may be impossible to do all in one day, it’s the kind of place you’ll want to go back to time and again.
ABOUT THE AUTHORITY
The Authority is an instrumentality of the Mohegan Tribe of Indians of Connecticut, a federally recognized Indian tribe with an approximately 507-acre reservation situated in southeastern Connecticut, adjacent to Uncasville, Connecticut.

The Authority has been granted the exclusive power to conduct and regulate gaming activities on the existing reservation of the Tribe, including the operation of Mohegan Sun, a gaming and entertainment complex that is situated on a 185-acre site on the Tribe’s reservation. Through its subsidiary, Downs Racing, L.P., the Authority also owns and operates Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs, a gaming and entertainment facility offering slot machines and harness racing in Plains Township, Pennsylvania and several OTW facilities located elsewhere in Pennsylvania.

ABOUT THE AUTHORITY
The Authority is an instrumentality of the Mohegan Tribe of Indians of Connecticut, a federally recognized Indian tribe with an approximately 507-acre reservation situated in southeastern Connecticut, adjacent to Uncasville, Connecticut.

The Authority has been granted the exclusive power to conduct and regulate gaming activities on the existing reservation of the Tribe, including the operation of Mohegan Sun, a gaming and entertainment complex that is situated on a 185-acre site on the Tribe’s reservation. Through its subsidiary, Downs Racing, L.P., the Authority also owns and operates Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs, a gaming and entertainment facility offering slot machines and harness racing in Plains Township, Pennsylvania and several OTW facilities located elsewhere in Pennsylvania.

Pocono Libertarians Background
Every locality has on-going discussions about community and national issues.  They occur in service clubs, community organizations or the media.  More often than not, though, they center on how to use the power of government to improve conditions or to solve problems, with a firm conviction that government can solve all problems and that it can do no harm.
Libertarians take issue with the involuntary means government uses to attain its ends.  Mandates and prohibitions invariably limit the allowable range of experimentation.  Freedom allows spontaneous order, which is seen in systems as diverse as artificial neural networks, agoric computers, biological evolution, ecosystems, and free-market economies.

Our monthly op-ed column entitled, "The Liberty Corner" can be read in the award-winning Community Express newspaper distributed throughout our area.
Our motto is, in the words of the late Nobel laureate Friedrich A. Hayek, " to make the building of a free society once more an intellectual adventure."
Read what Ernie Preate Jr., Former Attorney General of Pennsylvania and other past speakers have said about the Pocono Libertarians!
Don't forget to stop on by to sign and view our guestbook!
Don't forget to visit our Webrings!

Many of the things that the government tries to do from good intentions could be better handled by spontaneous voluntary systems, and often governments attempts to impose solutions to problems do more harm than good.
Investor's Business Daily and the internationally published Financial Times featured stories pointing out the exponential growth of libertarian think-tanks and discussion clubs, like ours, which are once again focusing on the eternal conflict between government and freedom.
Founded in 1991, the Pocono Libertarians is a free monthly discussion forum bringing to Monroe County, Pennsylvania, interesting speakers and thought-provoking topics consistent with the philosophy of individual liberty, personal responsibility, free markets, and choice in all matters. It is the goal of the Pocono Libertarians to inject into the local dialog the premise that freedom does matter.  To that end, we sponsor a free monthly discussion forum usually held at 7pm, the third Thursday of each month.  We are proud of the programs we've hosted in our thirteen year history.

Country Club of the Poconos Golf Course
Country Club of the Poconos Golf Course is the crown jewel of the area hidden within one of the most picturesque landscapes in the entire Northeast. See the only Fazio designed golf course in Northest Pennsylvania with some of the most beautiful panoramic views you'll ever see.
It's hard to believe this much beauty can be so close to home for so many people.  Don't take our word for it, come out and see for yourself.  We will gladly get you out on the course for a few holes, show you our beautiful formal dining area and grill rooms, and show you our fitness facilities and spectacular indoor swimming pool.

ABOUT THE AUTHORITY
The Authority is an instrumentality of the Mohegan Tribe of Indians of Connecticut, a federally recognized Indian tribe with an approximately 507-acre reservation situated in southeastern Connecticut, adjacent to Uncasville, Connecticut.

The Authority has been granted the exclusive power to conduct and regulate gaming activities on the existing reservation of the Tribe, including the operation of Mohegan Sun, a gaming and entertainment complex that is situated on a 185-acre site on the Tribe’s reservation. Through its subsidiary, Downs Racing, L.P., the Authority also owns and operates Mohegan Sun at Pocono Downs, a gaming and entertainment facility offering slot machines and harness racing in Plains Township, Pennsylvania and several OTW facilities located elsewhere in Pennsylvania.

Pinecrest Lake Information - Pocono Lake Realty, Pocono Pines, PA
Pinecrest Lake
Secluded in the heart of the Pennsylvania Pocono Mountains, Pinecrest
Lake Offers the ultimate in Vacation Home Accommodations in a private
Estate setting.  The homes are clustered in a natural pine fourst immediately
adjacent to Pinecrest Lake.  Pinecrest Lake has been developed by leisure
Oriented professionals to provide not just a quality vacation home community
but also a superior vacation experience.  The Poconos have been known
for decades as being Pennsylvania's playground.  It is only a short distance
from Pinecrest Lake Resort to Championship Golf Courses, Major Pocono Ski
Areas, gift shops, attractions, and a selection of restaurants that
range form specializing in gourmet cuisine to catering to family needs.
You'll like the Poconos and you'll fall in love with Pinecrest Lake.
Lake and Swimming Pool
Pinecrest Lake's on site amenities include a 77 acre lake with guarded
beach area, boating and fishing.  Our Mountain sized outdoor heated swimming
pool has a diving and water slide area, and a separate area for swimming
laps or just playing around.  For the little ones there is a wading pool
apart from the main pool.

Pocono Mountains golf properties and value-laden golf packages are available on www.poconosgolf.com, which allows players to enjoy majestic mountain-view scenery, the area's natural splendor, year-round amenities and unequaled value and variety.
Attributes of the golf-and-resort properties and destination include:
Home to hundreds of golf holes at numerous clubs, many located close to one another:
• Two NASCAR races held annually each spring-summer
• Golden Era of Golf Architecture period designs strongly represented by legendary designers Donald Ross and A.W. Tillinghast
• Golf, lodging and resort accommodations at all price points, from luxury to value
• Hiking, biking, camping, spas, horseback riding, boating, fishing, hunting and many other activities
• Attractions, festivals and other special events
• Meeting and conference facilities
• Great food at a wide array of eating establishments and resort restaurants
• Bed & breakfasts, country inns and resorts
• Antique shops, outlet malls and other unique shopping venues

Whether golfers are looking for a championship layout to test their skills or an affordable, player-friendly course for every member of the family, the Pocono Mountains have something for everyone.
Off the golf course, the four-county offers fine dining, luxurious spas, historical site seeing, boating and miles of hiking and biking trails - all in a lush, mountain setting.
 For more information on the area, visit www.800poconos.com or call 800-762-6667.
About the "Pocono Mountains: Discover Golf's Great Destination Secret"
The Pocono Mountains has long been known to avid travelers and mountain aficionados for its lush, relaxing family friendly ambiance and romantic setting, as well as its fall foliage, winter skiing, spring-summer outdoor recreation options and natural beauty.  Numerous lakes, parks and other environmental wonderlands are found throughout the four-county Pocono Mountains region.
Discerning golfers are well aware that the Pocono Mountains are home to golf courses designed by renowned architects such as Donald Ross and A.W. Tillinghast.  Golfer's Guide Marketing Solutions

Otter Lake Campground
Otter Lake Camp Resort offers 250 acres of spacious
wooded campsites where you can discover new pleasures with each new season.
Fishing and hiking in the spring, swimming and boating in the summer,
hunting and foliage-watching in the fall, and a variety of sports during
the winter months. Once you get here, paved roads lead to your beautiful
wooded campsite.  A fireplace, picnic table, electric, water, sewer, and
cable facilities all are waiting for you.  Drive-through trailer sites
and tent sites are also available.  Our excellent facilities include: eight
deluxe heated tile rest rooms and separate hot showers with private dressing
areas; a fully stocked store for all your camping needs; two dump stations
and two fully equipped laundromats.  Firewood and propane gas facilities
are available on the premises.

Mountain Vista Campground
Mountain Vista Campground is nestled in the scenic Pocono
Mountains and features large wooded sites with 50, 30 or 20 amp electric
service as well as water and sewer hookups, cable TV hookups, cabin rentals,
RV rentals, camping store with RV supplies, ice, firewood and more. On
site recreation includes swimming pool, stocked fishing pond, tennis court,
sand volleyball court, game room, table tennis, shuffleboard, bocce court,
horseshoe pits, badminton, basketball, playground, planned activities
and entertainment.  The campground is conveniently located for the Pocono's
nearby attractions including the Delaware Water Gap National Recreation
Area, golf courses, shopping, flea markets, attractions and restaurants.
Visit www.mtnvistacampground.com

Black Walnut - Bed and Breakfast Country Inn
Charming would be the word that best defines this 12
rooms stone house. This delightful, newly restored 1890's Inn is a beautiful
Tudor-style stone house with historic fireplace, antique furnishings and
brass beds.  Wake up with the smell of a hearty, home-cooked breakfast
and enjoy it while overlooking their 4-acre pond.  Take the kids to the
on-site petting zoo or relax on the large back deck with outdoor hot tub.
Couple getaway, family trip or group outing, the Black Walnut has something
for everyone.  Call for more information (570).  296.6322 or visit www.theblackwalnutinn.com/aboutthe.htm
The Inn at Jim Thorpe
Located in the historic village of Jim Thorpe, the Inn
was built in the 1840's and lovingly restored to bring back memories of
the Victorian opulence.  From their room furnishings to the entire architecture
style you can feel the .  Personalities like Thomas Edison and John D.
Rockefeller have passed through the Inn.

Poconos Bed and Breakfast / Inns
Bishwind Poconos Bed and Breakfast
Our featured Poconos Bed and Breakfast is the Bishwind
historic English style bed and breakfast, located in Bear Creek.  History
surrounds this peaceful, elegant place which has hosted personalities
like Theodore Roosevelt, William Howard Taft and Sikorsky among others.
Lovely decorated bedrooms and suites with fireplaces, jacuzzi baths, terraces
overlooking the garden and a wide array of amenities that surpass what
you'd normaly expect from a B&B.

Even though we will still go every year.
Some guests have complained about the service being a little slow in the dining room. It can be, but we did not care because we wanted to take our time and relax.  The staff has alot of people to serve in a short period of time.
I have special dietary need and all I had to do it call the kitchen with my special needs and they took care of me.
Some of the activities are x-rated and some people may not like that.  We have taken our parents with us and they would just skip those activities.
All in all, we love Caesars and will continue to return.

A large portion of the forest has been allowed to mature untouched by man.
A nature walk through the woods will reveal a large variety of indigenous trees such as American Beech, Black Cherry, Eastern Hemlock, Red Maples, Sugar maples and various Birches.  Hay-Scented Ferns, Lowbush Blueberry, and Princess Pine cover the forest floor.   In the Spring and Summer, the beauty of the forest is ever present between the Shadbush, Rhododendron and wildflowers.    In the Fall, the forest is a parade of autumn colors.
 
  Pocono Plateaus mission is to provide opportunities to experience the Gospel of Jesus Christ though recreation, challenge and reflection.    There is no better place to reflect upon lifes choices than being surrounded by Gods beautiful creation.    The EcoEternity Forest allows our ministry to impact lives on the most challenging aspect of life preparation for death - by focusing on the hope of the Gospel message.

About the Golf Course
Designed by the late Robert Trent Jones Sr. in 1947,
Tamiment Golf Club
features a historic and scenic mountain top course that is nestled in
the spectacular Pocono region and just 5 minutes away from Pocmont Resort.
The classic style design features tree lined fairways, majestic views,
undulating greens and strategically placed bunkers.
Originally established in 1947, Tamiment Golf Club is a traditional golf
experience that provides it's golfing guests with the opportunity to experience
a golf course that was created prior to the days of island greens, railroad
ties and "Hershey Kiss" shaped mounding.

Golf purists will appreciate
the layout that is not cluttered with hazards, yet rewards the golfer
who takes a well thought out approach to playing each hole.

This cozy, immaculate 3 bedroom home is only a few blocks away from two of three community pools.  This home, a perfect getaway during any season, is located in the most prestigious vacation community in the Pocono's.  Perfectly situated on a private wooded lot in Arrowhead Lakes, a gated resort community in the Pocono Mountains.  This home features the best of vacationing with an abundant array of activities at your fingertips!  Whether you want an action packed, exciting vacation adventure or you want a peaceful getaway - this is the home for your special vacation!
Cozy up in front of the gas fireplace in the wide open living room or enjoy TV with digital cable and a DVD player.  Home also features wireless high speed internet.  The kitchen is very well equipped so you can prepare any meal.  Each individual bedroom features a private television with cable.  Take advantage of the three season room with fantastic views of the surrounding woods or relax on the beautiful large private deck.
Area Description
Arrowhead Lakes is a premier amenity filled community located on a huge lake, and only a few miles to Jack Frost & Big Boulder ski areas.  The community offers 24 hour security, 2 stocked lakes with beaches, 3 pools, playgrounds, tennis & basketball courts, boat rentals and organized activities.

Wh have stayed at all of their resorts in the Poconos and like Pocono Palace for its view over the lake from the rooms and the dining room. We like the activity directors at Pradise Stream.  Each resort it slightly different but each has positive things to offer.  You can go the the Caesars resorts and not have to worry about tipping, dinner or breakfast bills, or cover charges.  The resort is all inclusive.  The only thing you may need to buy is lunch.  We were sorry to see that the Brookdale on the Lake resort was sold.  Even though we will still go every year.
Some guests have complained about the service being a little slow in the dining room.  It can be, but we did not care because we wanted to take our time and relax.  The staff has alot of people to serve in a short period of time.
I have special dietary need and all I had to do it call the kitchen with my special needs and they took care of me.
Some of the activities are x-rated and some people may not like that.  We have taken our parents with us and they would just skip those activities.
All in all, we love Caesars and will continue to return.

In addition to
sensational courses and accommodations, golfers will find a large
variety of 19th hole options, from casual fare to fine dining to
even casino nightlife. There is truly something for everyone in the
Pocono Mountains!
 
  When it is All About the Game
What makes a golf trip memorable will always be the same.  Laughing
with friends, pursuit of the ever-elusive eagle, and being treated
like the pros.  Some things just never change.
  And then again… some things do.
Genesis Golf Trips
offers customized golf packages combining features that golfers
should always expect: affordability and course variety into a golf
experience that exceeds your group's desires.
Golf Packages Made Easy
We are experienced packagers that love the game of golf and know
what it takes to put together a great golf package.  Whether you
are
planning a golf vacation for four or forty, you will receive a great
hassle-free golf value.  So, call us today and spend less time
planning and more time playing!
Genesis Golf Trips…The NEW Swing in Golf
Packaging!
 
Instant Package Quotes Online!
Now booking your golf package is even easier.

Now this
scenic area, known for its amazing landscapes, is drawing golfers
who want to step into the pages of yesteryear and golf on classic
courses in style or challenge themselves with newer course
additions. 
We invite you to take your next golf trip vacation to the Pocono
Mountains where you can choose from 13 golf courses for the ultimate
golf-around. Mother Nature laid the framework for amazing
courses throughout this region, and they are all worth the visit. 
From hilly fairways to mountainous backdrops, every course makes use
of its natural surroundings to present you with a test of golf that
you will never forget.  Some of best names in golf design have carved
out classic golf layouts that can stand the test of time - from
golf designers Donald Ross, Jim Fazio, Nicholas Psiaha, Robert White and A.W.
Tillinghast to newer names such as Terry Lagree and many others.  
Genesis has partnered with the best golf courses and
hotels in the area to give you an experience that is unsurpassed by
other destinations of its type.    As a region, the Pocono Mountains
has been catering to visitors for over a century, as you will soon
see upon your arrival in this dynamic golf destination!

Buck Hill Falls Golf Club  home to 27 holes, 18 of which were designed by Donald Ross  has continued adding tee boxes, particularly forward boxes, to make the course more playable for higher handicaps and championship tees, to make the course more challenging for lower handicap players. The club also is in the process of renovating approximately 30 bunkers and will be implementing 10-minute tee time intervals to counter congestion.  Cherry Valley Golf Course also added or rebuilt tee boxes for increased yardage, while renovating bunkers and cart paths.
Split Rock Resort & Golf Club in Lake Harmony continues work on the new nine holes with an expected opening of 2009, bringing the total number of holes to 36.  Like many Pocono Mountain properties, the resort has introduced new value-laden midweek specials.  Likewise, Hideaway Hills Golf Club in Kresgeville is catering to the 60-and-over crowd by extending its Senior Day to days  Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday.
The Country Club at Woodloch Springs in Hawley and Fernwood Hotel and Resort in Bushkill are also in the midst of enhancements designed to improve the overall golfing experience by widening select fairways and increasing landing areas.
Gaming has come to the Pocono Mountains, as well.  The Mount Airy Casino Resort recently introduced slots to the region.

St. Ann's Basilica. |
St. Ann's Basilica.
The solemn dedication of the Basilica of the National Shrine of St.Ann takes place in October of 1997.  There are more than 20,000 Cathholic churches in the United States, but less than 40 are basilicas.  St. Ann's will be the fifth in Pennsylvania.

The church which is off Main Avenue in Scranton, just down from the Houdini Museum, draws between 1,500 and 2,000 people for its novena service every Monday. The summertime novena brings out 10,000.  These numbers are now expected to increase.
